src:
Flytr√∏bbel for United-supportere p√• Gardermoen: ‚Äì En haug med rasende folk
Et SAS-fly med tekniske problemer skapte frustrasjon og fortvilelse hos flere Manchester United-supportere.
07 Nov 2019, 16:08 by Lars S√∏rnes
Ole Gunnar Solskj√¶rs menn m√∏ter Partizan Beograd p√• Old Trafford torsdag kveld. Europa League-kampen har avspark klokken 21.
P√• Oslo lufthavn Gardermoen skulle flere United-supportere ta SAS-flyet som etter planen skulle lette klokken 10.55 torsdag formiddag. Men slik gikk det ikke.
‚Äì Vi fikk h√∏re at dette flyet kom fra London. F√∏r avgang der lyste en lampe som indikerte at den ene flyd√∏ra ikke var igjen, selv om den faktisk var det. Men vi fikk beskjed om at problemet var l√∏st, sier Lars Morten Olsen.
Han er redakt√∏r i medlemsbladet United-Supporteren, og ansl√•r at det var opp mot 100 United-supportere som skulle ta flyet og dra p√• kamp torsdag.

Solskj√¶r hyller McTominay: ‚Äì Han har v√¶rt fantastisk

‚Äì Fortvilende dag
Da SAS-flyet taxet ut p√• Gardermoen, s√• oppsto samme problem igjen, if√∏lge Olsen.
‚Äì Flyet fikk ikke lov til √• ta av. Vi satt i flyet i to timer f√∏r vi m√•tte g√• ut, sier han.


Fra venstre: Jan Freddy Olsen, Bj√∏rn Gjelseng, Lars Morten Olsen, Thomas J√∏rgensen og Morten Engseth opplyser om lang ventetid p√• SAS-flyet.üì∑ Privat

Informasjonssjef Knut Morten Johansen i SAS opplyste til Aftenposten like f√∏r klokken 16 at flyet skulle lette klokken 16.45. Senere kom det flere meldinger til passasjerene om stadig mindre forsinkelser.



Les Johansens forklaring p√• problemene lenger ned i saken.



Flyet tok endelig av fra Gardermoen klokken 18.08 torsdag kveld ‚Äì over sju timer for sent. Flytiden er beregnet til 1 time og 40 minutter til Manchester. Dermed kan de muligens rekke kampstart p√• Old Trafford med et n√∏dskrik.
Troms√∏v√¶ringen J√∏rn Hagen var ogs√• blant dem som m√•tte vente i over sju timer p√• Gardermoen i dag. Sammen med s√∏nnen Gustav (14), Bj√∏rn Litveit Hansen og hans s√∏nn Aksel (14) kom han til Oslo onsdag kveld for √• v√¶re sikker p√• √• rekke avgangen klokken 10.55 torsdag formiddag.
‚Äì Det har v√¶rt en fortvilende dag som har skapt stor frustrasjon, sier J√∏rn Hagen.
Han er sv√¶rt misforn√∏yd med den manglende informasjonen fra flyselskapets side.
‚Äì Det kom hele tiden ny informasjon om at det skulle komme ny informasjon. S√• sendte de noen SAS-ansatte som ikke visste hva det gikk ut p√•, og som m√•tte st√• der √• ta imot all frustasjonen til passasjerene. Dette er elendig serviceinnstilling fra SAS, sier Hagen.

Keeperkaos for Manchester City: M√•tte bruke utespiller i m√•l

‚Äì Utrolig d√•rlig
J√∏rn Hagen forst√•r ikke at det ikke ble iverksatt alternative l√∏sninger p√• et tidlig tidspunkt.
‚Äì De kunne funnet en reservel√∏sning som de kunne kalle tilbake hvis de tekniske problemene l√∏ste seg p√• et tidlig tidspunkt, og de kunne ombooket passasjerene. Alle ville v√¶rt fremme i Manchester i god tid og v√¶rt forn√∏yd. I stedet var det en haug med rasende folk her, sier han.
‚Äì Og det at de ikke kan gi oss skikkelig informasjon synes jeg er utrolig d√•rlig, legger Hagen til.

Informasjonssjef Knut Morten Johansen beklager p√• det sterkeste at det ble s√• lang ventetid p√• passasjerene.


‚Äì Det oppsto et teknisk problem med flyet, og feils√∏kingen tok tid. Men n√• har vi funnet en l√∏sning p√• det, sier han.



Informasjonssjef Knut Morten Johansen i SAS beklager overfor passasjerene.üì∑ Christine Schefte / Adresseavisen

Han er godt kjent med at det har v√¶rt misn√∏ye og frustrasjon blant flere av de reisende.

‚Äì Hvorfor har dere ikke gitt mer informasjon?

‚Äì Det har ikke v√¶rt annen informasjon √• gi. Det er bedre √• gi informasjon n√•r vi har noe konkret √• komme med. Men jeg skal love alle sammen at vi har jobbet p√• spreng for √• l√∏se problemene, understreker Johansen.

Solskj√¶r holdt rasismem√∏te med spillerne f√∏r kampen i Serbia

‚Äì Kjedelig
Lars Morten Olsen forteller at flere av de reisende skal se flere kamper p√• ball√∏ya, mens det er andre som kun har planlagt √• se kampen mellom Manchester United og Partizan Beograd torsdag kveld.
‚Äì Heldigvis er det sjelden at det skjer slike ting som i dag. Det er ekstra kjedelig for de som ikke reiser s√• ofte, sier Olsen.


Passasjerene fikk g√• om bord i SAS-flyet rundt klokken 17.15 torsdag ettermiddag. Flyet tok av klokken 18.08.üì∑ Privat
text:
Flight trouble for United supporters at Gardermoen: - A bunch of furious people
A SAS flight with technical problems caused frustration and despair by several Manchester United supporters.
07 Nov 2019, 16:08 by Lars S√∏rnes
Ole Gunnar Solsk√¶r's men meet Partizan Belgrade at Old Trafford on Thursday evening. The Europa League match kicks off at 9pm.
At Oslo Airport Gardermoen, several United supporters were to take the SAS aircraft, which was scheduled to light at 10.55 on Thursday morning. But that was not the case.
- We were told that this plane was from London. Before departure there was a light indicating that one of the escape doors was not left, even though it was. But we were told that the problem was solved, says Lars Morten Olsen.
He is the editor of the member supporter United Supporter, and estimates that it was up to 100 United supporters who would catch the plane and go to battle on Thursday.

Sunshine paid tribute to McTominay: - He's been fantastic

- Desperate day
When the SAS plane took off at Gardermoen, the same problem arose again, according to Olsen.
- The plane was not allowed to take off. We sat in the plane for two hours before we had to leave, he says.


From left: Jan Freddy Olsen, Bj√∏rn Gjelseng, Lars Morten Olsen, Thomas J√∏rgensen and Morten Engseth announce a long wait for the SAS aircraft.üì∑ Private

Head of Information Knut Morten Johansen of SAS informed Aftenposten just before 4 pm that the plane would light off at 16.45. Later, several messages came to the passengers about ever smaller delays.



Read Johansen's explanation of the problems further down in the case.



The plane finally took off from Gardermoen at 18.08 on Thursday evening - over seven hours late. Flight time is 1 hour 40 minutes to Manchester. Thus, they may be able to hit the starting line-up at Old Trafford with an emergency scream.
The drummer J√∏rn Hagen was also among those who had to wait over seven hours at Gardermoen today. Together with his son Gustav (14), Bj√∏rn Litveit Hansen and his son Aksel (14), he arrived in Oslo on Wednesday evening to be sure to reach the departure at 10.55 on Thursday morning.
- It has been a desperate day that has caused great frustration, says J√∏rn Hagen.
He is very dissatisfied with the lack of information from the airline.
- New information was constantly coming up that new information would come. Then they sent some SAS staff who did not know what it was about and who had to stand there to receive all the frustration of the passengers. This is lousy service attitude from SAS, says Hagen.

Goalkeeper chaos for Manchester City: Had to use the player in goal

- Incredibly bad
J√∏rn Hagen does not understand that alternative solutions were not implemented at an early stage.
- They could find a backup solution that they could call back if the technical problems were resolved at an early stage and they could rebook the passengers. Everyone would have arrived in Manchester well in advance and been satisfied. Instead, there were a bunch of furious people here, he says.
- And the fact that they can't give us proper information, I think is incredibly bad, Hagen adds.

Chief Information Officer Knut Morten Johansen strongly regrets that there was such a long wait for passengers.


- There was a technical problem with the aircraft, and the troubleshooting took time. But now we have found a solution to that, he says.



Information Manager Knut Morten Johansen at SAS apologizes to the passengers.üì∑ Christine Schefte / Adresseavisen

He is well aware that there has been dissatisfaction and frustration among several of the travelers.

- Why didn't you provide more information?

- There was no other information to give. It is better to give information when we have something specific to come up with. But I promise everyone that we have worked hard to solve the problems, ‚Äùemphasizes Johansen.

Sunshine held a racism meeting with the players before the match in Serbia

- Boring
Lars Morten Olsen says that several of the travelers will see more matches on the ball island, while others have only planned to see the match between Manchester United and Partizan Belgrade on Thursday night.
- Fortunately, it is rare that such things happen today. It's extra boring for those who don't travel that often, says Olsen.


Passengers were allowed to board the SAS aircraft around 5:15 pm on Thursday afternoon. The plane took off at 18.08.üì∑ Private
